page.title: 02PLASHETT _ FARMING
page.content: Farming in this area is mostly grassland grazed by dairy cattle. However there is some cereal production , mostly wheat and barley with a little maize. The land is gently undulating , divided by a few minor roads. The fields are generally divided by hedges mostly hawthorn and blackberry. There are seventeen farms named on the map of which three are not presently working. The houses are mostly occupied by retired farmers. One of the farms produces eggs and another uses organic methods. The flour produced at this farm is used by a Brighton baker . There are at least three farms with large acreages with agricultural workers living in tied cottages . The soil is a mixture of chalk and clay and drainage can be a problem.
